p: Many strains of influenza virus infect a large array of animal species, including humans, various avian, canine, feline and porcine species, and even marine mammals [ Li et al., 2015]. Birds are found to be the largest reservoirs of the new strains of flu virus. Pig cells have 2 kinds of receptors, i.e., one targeted by flu viruses that infect humans and another targeted by flu strains that infect birds [ Ito et al., 1998]. Therefore, in pigs, different strains of flu viruses can swap their genetic material, creating novel more virulent strains.
